# Roleplay Rule 7 – Do Not Stall Progression
Prospect Sector rounds are designed around **cooperative progression**, where the station is rebuilt, expeditions are completed, and the crew pushes toward higher difficulty tiers. A round is expected to move forward at a steady pace. Players should **not deliberately slow, block, or sabotage the natural progression of the round**.
Actions that intentionally delay upgrades, halt expeditions, obstruct station repairs, or prevent players from progressing toward round completion are considered **round stalling**.
Because Prospect Sector does not use a traditional evacuation shuttle end condition, round stalling revolves around **progression-based milestones**, not shuttle calls.
## What counts as stalling? Round stalling includes any behavior that: - Stops or severely delays the crew’s ability to advance expedition difficulty. - Blocks access to required station systems needed for progression. - Intentionally prevents departments from functioning (engineering, cargo, science, etc.). - Hoards critical materials, gear, or tools solely to stop others from progressing. - Refuses to allow the round to progress when the **majority of active players** want to continue forward. - Undermines or halts the natural flow of station development.
## What does *not* count as stalling? - Taking a reasonable amount of time to prepare the station. - Coordinating as a group to push higher difficulty expeditions. - Wanting a long, stable round **as long as progression is still happening**. - Slowdowns caused by legitimate in-game issues (repairs, low materials, recovering from disasters). - A department being busy or understaffed.
## Examples
### Acceptable: - The crew decides to play a longer shift and continue expanding the station, and everyone continues to contribute. - Engineering pauses expeditions temporarily to repair major damage after an asteroid event. - Cargo delays an expedition launch for a few minutes while sorting returned loot. - Command asks for time to build key departments before pushing higher expedition tiers. - A player takes a short break or works at a slower pace while still contributing overall.
### Prohibited: - A player hoards all high-tier gear or materials and refuses to let the station progress. - A group refuses to run any expeditions despite the rest of the crew wanting to continue progression. - Blocking access to the magnet, expedition gate, or critical machinery to stop progress. - Destroying or disabling essential systems (power, atmos, cargo storage, magnet) to freeze progression. - Intentionally refusing to complete required objectives that stop the round from ending. - Deliberately keeping the station in a broken or unusable state to halt gameplay.
## Final Note Progression is the core of Prospect Sector. You are expected to participate in it—or at the very least, **not prevent others from doing so**.
Admins have final say on what constitutes round stalling based on the situation.
